cookingMethod: Wash the rice in cold water and soak it for 30 minutes. In a separate bowl, marinate the chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Let it sit for at least an hour. In a deep-bottomed pan, heat ghee and add sliced onions. Fry until the onions turn golden brown. Add bay leaf, cinnamon stick, cloves, and cardamom. Fry for a few seconds. Add sliced tomatoes, green chili, and fry until the tomatoes turn mushy. Add the marinated chicken and fry on high heat for 5 minutes. Add 1 cup of water and mix well. Cover the pan with a lid and let it cook on low heat for 15 minutes. In a separate pot, boil water and add the soaked rice. Cook until the rice is 80% done. Drain the excess water. Layer the chicken and rice alternatively in a deep-bottomed pot. Add mint leaves and coriander leaves on top. Cover the pot with a lid and seal the edges with dough. Cook on low heat for 20 minutes. Once done, remove the lid and serve hot.

Heat oil in a pan and add onions. Fry until golden brown. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, and green chilies. Fry for a few minutes. Add chicken and fry until golden brown. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Fry for a few minutes. Add tomato puree and fry until the oil separates. Add yogurt and mix well. Add water and salt. Cover the pan and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes. Add garam masala powder and mix well. Cook for another 5 minutes. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

ingredients: Chicken breast, cut into small pieces - 500g
Fresh coriander leaves, chopped - for garnish
cookingMethod: In a pan, heat oil and add onion, garlic, ginger and green chillies. Fry until onions turn translucent. Add chicken and fry until it turns brown. Add chopped tomatoes and tomato paste, and cook until the tomatoes are soft. Add chopped bell peppers, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10-12 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or naan.

To make the chole, heat oil in a pressure cooker and add cumin seeds, bay leaf, green cardamom pods, cloves, and cinnamon stick. Once they start to splutter, add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute. Then add chopped tomatoes, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes turn mushy. Add soaked chickpeas and enough water to cover them. Pressure cook for 4-5 whistles or until the chickpeas are cooked through. For the bhature, mix together flour, salt, baking powder, and oil. Add yogurt and mix well. Knead into a soft dough using water as required. Cover and rest for 30 minutes. Divide the dough into equal portions and roll out into circles. Deep fry until golden brown. Serve hot with chole.

ingredients: Fresh coriander leaves, chopped for garnish
cookingMethod: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they start to splutter, add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute. Then add chopped tomatoes, green chilies, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes turn mushy. Add prawns and enough water to cover them. Cover the pan and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes or until the prawns are cooked through. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice.

Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds, bay leaf, cinnamon stick, green cardamom pods, and cloves. Once they start to splutter, add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste, green chillies, and sauté for a minute. Then add chopped tomatoes, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, garam masala powder, cumin powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes turn mushy. Add 1/2 cup water and let it simmer for 5 minutes. Add boiled eggs and let them cook in the gravy for 5-7 minutes. Serve hot with rice or roti.

In a pan, heat butter and sauté chopped onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute. Add pureed tomatoes and cook until the oil separates from the mixture. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add paneer cubes and water as required. Cook for 5-7 minutes. Add heavy cream and cook for another minute. Serve hot with rice or naan.

To make the puri, mix together semolina, all-purpose flour, and salt. Add enough water to make a stiff dough. Cover and rest for 30 minutes. Divide the dough into small balls and roll out into circles. Heat oil in a deep frying pan and fry the puris until they puff up and turn golden brown. To make the pani, blend together mint leaves, coriander leaves, green chili, ginger, cumin powder, chaat masala powder, black salt, tamarind pulp, lemon juice, salt, and water to make a smooth paste. Adjust the consistency by adding more water if required. To make the filling, mix together boiled chickpeas, chopped onion, chopped tomato, cumin powder, chaat masala powder, and salt. To assemble, make a small hole in the puri and fill it with the chickpea filling. Dip the filled puri in the pani and enjoy!

To make the bati, mix together whole wheat flour, semolina, ghee, carom seeds, and salt. Add enough water to make a stiff dough. Divide into equal portions and shape into balls. Preheat the oven to 350°F and bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. For the dal, wash the dal and pressure cook with water and salt for 3-4 whistles or until cooked. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds, bay leaf, green cardamom pods, cloves, and cinnamon stick. Once they start to splutter, add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute. Then add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes turn mushy. Add the cooked dal and enough water to get the desired consistency. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5-10 minutes. Serve the dal with bati, ghee, and chutney.

In a mixing bowl, combine flour, salt, cumin powder, coriander powder, and red chili powder. Add boiled and mashed potatoes, grated ginger, chopped green chilies, chopped cilantro, and oil. Mix well. Knead into a smooth dough using water as required. Divide the dough into small equal portions. Roll out each portion into a small circle. Heat oil in a deep frying pan. Deep fry the puris until they are puffed and golden brown. Serve hot with chole or any other curry of your choice.

ingredients: A few sprigs of coriander leaves, chopped
cookingMethod: To make the Dhokla batter, mix together gram flour, semolina, sugar, salt, turmeric powder, ginger paste, green chili paste, lemon juice, oil, and water to form a smooth batter. Add fruit salt and mix well. Pour the batter into a greased dhokla plate and steam for 15-20 minutes until cooked. To make the tempering, heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and sesame seeds. Once they start to splutter, add green chilies and sauté for a few seconds. Then, add water, sugar, lemon juice, and salt. Cook until the sugar dissolves. Pour this tempering over the steamed dhokla and garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Cut into pieces and serve.

1. Rinse the rice and lentils separately and soak them in enough water for at least 6 hours or overnight.
2. Drain the water and grind the rice and lentils separately with some water to make a smooth batter.
3. Mix the batter together in a large bowl, add salt to taste, and whisk well to aerate the batter.
4. Cover the bowl with a lid or a cloth and let the batter ferment in a warm place for at least 8-12 hours or until it doubles in volume and develops a sour aroma.
5. When ready to make dosa, heat a non-stick or cast-iron griddle over medium heat.
6. Once hot, pour a ladleful of batter onto the center of the griddle and spread it in a circular motion to form a thin crepe.
7. Drizzle some oil or ghee on the edges and cook the dosa until the edges turn golden brown and the surface looks crispy.
8. Flip the dosa using a spatula and cook the other side for a few seconds.
9. Serve hot with chutney, sambar, or any accompaniment of your choice.

ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces
Fresh coriander leaves, chopped, for garnishing
cookingMethod: In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken, yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric, cumin, coriander, and red chilli powder. Mix well, cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or overnight. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease a baking tray and arrange the chicken pieces in a single layer. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the tomato puree and cook for 5-7 minutes or until the oil separates. Stir in the cream and garam masala powder. Add the baked chicken pieces to the sauce and simmer for 5-7 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Season with salt to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.

ingredients: 2 large potatoes, peeled and cut into small cubes
cookingMethod: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and cook until they start to sizzle. Add the chopped onion and cook until it becomes translucent. Add the potatoes, salt, turmeric, ground cumin, ground coriander, and garam masala. Mix well and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the cauliflower, green chilies, ginger, and garlic. Mix well and cook for another 5 minutes. Stir in the tomato paste and water. Mix well and cover the skillet. Cook for 10-15 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Garnish with cilantro leaves and serve hot.

ingredients: 2 bunches of spinach, washed and chopped
cookingMethod:
1. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle.
2. Add chopped onion and cook until it turns translucent.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
4. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and red chili powder. Cook for a minute.
5. Add chopped tomato and cook until it turns mushy.
6. Add chopped spinach and cook until it wilts down.
7. Let the mixture cool down, and then blend it to a smooth puree.
8. Heat the same pan over medium heat. Add the spinach puree and bring it to a boil.
9. Add the paneer cubes and cook for 5-7 minutes.
10. Add heavy cream and salt to taste. Cook for a couple more minutes.
11. Serve hot with naan or rice.

1. Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add turmeric powder and red chilli powder.
2. Add the mashed potatoes and salt to taste. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
3. Allow the potato filling to cool.
4. In a mixing bowl, add gram flour, baking soda, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, and salt to taste. Mix well and add water to make a thick batter.
5. Take a small portion of the potato filling and shape it into a ball.
6. Dip the potato ball in the gram flour batter and coat it well.
7. Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the potato balls until golden brown.
8. To assemble the vada pav, slit the pav bun horizontally.
9. Spread green chutney, tamarind chutney, and garlic chutney on the inside of the pav bun.
10. Place the vada in between the pav bun.
11. Add a dollop of butter on top of the vada and close the bun.
12. Serve hot.

1. Wash the rice and soak it in water for at least 4 hours. Wash the urad dal, chana dal, and fenugreek seeds and soak them in water for at least 4 hours.
2. Grind the soaked rice and dal mixture separately into a fine batter, adding water as needed.
3. Mix the rice and dal batters together, add salt to taste, and let the batter ferment overnight.
4. Heat a non-stick pan and spread some oil on it. Pour a ladleful of the dosa batter on the pan and spread it into a thin layer. Cook until golden brown and crispy.
5. For the masala, heat some oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. When they crackle, add turmeric powder and red chili powder. Stir for a few seconds.
6. Add chopped onions, green chili, and ginger. Cook until onions turn translucent.
7. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they are soft and mushy.
8. Add boiled and mashed potatoes, salt, and coriander leaves. Mix well and cook for a few minutes.
9. To serve, place a spoonful of the masala in the center of the dosa and fold it over. Serve with coconut chutney and sambar on the side.

In a mixing bowl, combine mashed potatoes, bread crumbs, onion, coriander leaves, ginger, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, chaat masala, and salt. Mix well to form a dough. Divide the dough into equal-sized portions and shape them into patties. Heat oil in a shallow pan and place the patties in it. Cook on medium heat until golden brown on both sides. Serve hot with mint chutney and tamarind chutney.
